39/******************************************************
40 ******************** Identify GMP ********************
41 ******************************************************/
42
43/* Macro to detect the GMP version */
44#if defined(__GNU_MP_VERSION) && \
45 defined(__GNU_MP_VERSION_MINOR) && \
46 defined(__GNU_MP_VERSION_PATCHLEVEL)
47# define __MPFR_GMP(a,b,c) \
48 (MPFR_VERSION_NUM(__GNU_MP_VERSION,__GNU_MP_VERSION_MINOR,__GNU_MP_VERSION_PATCHLEVEL) >= MPFR_VERSION_NUM(a,b,c))
49#else
50# define __MPFR_GMP(a,b,c) 0
51#endif
52
53
54
55/******************************************************
56 ******************** Check GMP ***********************
57 ******************************************************/
58
59#if !__MPFR_GMP(5,0,0) && !defined(MPFR_USE_MINI_GMP)
60# error "GMP 5.0.0 or newer is required"
61#endif
62
63#if GMP_NAIL_BITS != 0
64# error "MPFR doesn't support nonzero values of GMP_NAIL_BITS"
65#endif
66
67#if (GMP_NUMB_BITS<32) || (GMP_NUMB_BITS & (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1))
68# error "GMP_NUMB_BITS must be a power of 2, and >= 32"
69#endif
70
71#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 32
72# define MPFR_LOG2_GMP_NUMB_BITS 5
73#elif GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
74# define MPFR_LOG2_GMP_NUMB_BITS 6
75#elif GMP_NUMB_BITS == 128
76# define MPFR_LOG2_GMP_NUMB_BITS 7
77#elif GMP_NUMB_BITS == 256
78# define MPFR_LOG2_GMP_NUMB_BITS 8
79#else
80# error "Can't compute log2(GMP_NUMB_BITS)"
81#endif
82
83
84
85/******************************************************
86 ************* Define GMP Internal Interface *********
87 ******************************************************/
88
89#ifdef MPFR_HAVE_GMP_IMPL /* with gmp build */
90
91#define mpfr_allocate_func (*__gmp_allocate_func)
92#define mpfr_reallocate_func (*__gmp_reallocate_func)
93#define mpfr_free_func (*__gmp_free_func)
94
95#else /* without gmp build (gmp-impl.h replacement) */
96
97/* The following tries to get a good version of alloca.
98 See gmp-impl.h for implementation details and original version */
99/* FIXME: the autoconf manual gives a different piece of code under the
100 documentation of the AC_FUNC_ALLOCA macro. Should we switch to it? */
101#ifndef alloca
102# if defined ( __GNUC__ )
103# define alloca __builtin_alloca
104# elif defined (__DECC)
105# define alloca(x) __ALLOCA(x)
106# elif defined (_MSC_VER)
107# include <malloc.h>
108# define alloca _alloca
109# elif defined (HAVE_ALLOCA_H)
110# include <alloca.h>
111# elif defined (_AIX) || defined (_IBMR2)
112# pragma alloca
113# else
114void *alloca (size_t);
115# endif
116#endif
117
118/* Define some macros */
119
120#define ULONG_HIGHBIT (ULONG_MAX ^ ((unsigned long) ULONG_MAX >> 1))
121#define UINT_HIGHBIT (UINT_MAX ^ ((unsigned) UINT_MAX >> 1))
122#define USHRT_HIGHBIT ((unsigned short) (USHRT_MAX ^ ((unsigned short) USHRT_MAX >> 1)))
123
124
125#if __GMP_MP_SIZE_T_INT
126#define MP_SIZE_T_MAX INT_MAX
127#define MP_SIZE_T_MIN INT_MIN
128#else
129#define MP_SIZE_T_MAX LONG_MAX
130#define MP_SIZE_T_MIN LONG_MIN
131#endif
132
133/* MP_LIMB macros */
134#define MPN_ZERO(dst, n) memset((dst), 0, (n)*MPFR_BYTES_PER_MP_LIMB)
135#define MPN_COPY(dst,src,n) \
136 do \
137 { \
138 if ((dst) != (src)) \
139 { \
140 MPFR_ASSERTD ((char *) (dst) >= (char *) (src) + \
141 (n) * MPFR_BYTES_PER_MP_LIMB || \
142 (char *) (src) >= (char *) (dst) + \
143 (n) * MPFR_BYTES_PER_MP_LIMB); \
144 memcpy ((dst), (src), (n) * MPFR_BYTES_PER_MP_LIMB); \
145 } \
146 } \
147 while (0)
148
149/* MPN macros taken from gmp-impl.h */
150#define MPN_NORMALIZE(DST, NLIMBS) \
151 do { \
152 while (NLIMBS > 0) \
153 { \
154 if ((DST)[(NLIMBS) - 1] != 0) \
155 break; \
156 NLIMBS--; \
157 } \
158 } while (0)
159#define MPN_NORMALIZE_NOT_ZERO(DST, NLIMBS) \
160 do { \
161 MPFR_ASSERTD ((NLIMBS) >= 1); \
162 while (1) \
163 { \
164 if ((DST)[(NLIMBS) - 1] != 0) \
165 break; \
166 NLIMBS--; \
167 } \
168 } while (0)
169#define MPN_OVERLAP_P(xp, xsize, yp, ysize) \
170 ((xp) + (xsize) > (yp) && (yp) + (ysize) > (xp))
171#define MPN_SAME_OR_INCR2_P(dst, dsize, src, ssize) \
172 ((dst) <= (src) || ! MPN_OVERLAP_P (dst, dsize, src, ssize))
173#define MPN_SAME_OR_INCR_P(dst, src, size) \
174 MPN_SAME_OR_INCR2_P(dst, size, src, size)
175#define MPN_SAME_OR_DECR2_P(dst, dsize, src, ssize) \
176 ((dst) >= (src) || ! MPN_OVERLAP_P (dst, dsize, src, ssize))
177#define MPN_SAME_OR_DECR_P(dst, src, size) \
178 MPN_SAME_OR_DECR2_P(dst, size, src, size)
179
180/* If mul_basecase or mpn_sqr_basecase are not exported, used mpn_mul instead */
181#ifndef mpn_mul_basecase
182# define mpn_mul_basecase(dst,s1,n1,s2,n2) mpn_mul((dst),(s1),(n1),(s2),(n2))
183#endif
184#ifndef mpn_sqr_basecase
185# define mpn_sqr_basecase(dst,src,n) mpn_mul((dst),(src),(n),(src),(n))
186#endif
187
188/* ASSERT */
189__MPFR_DECLSPEC void mpfr_assert_fail (const char *, int,
190 const char *);
191
192#define ASSERT_FAIL(expr) mpfr_assert_fail (__FILE__, __LINE__, #expr)
193/* ASSERT() is for mpfr-longlong.h only. */
194#define ASSERT(expr) MPFR_ASSERTD(expr)
195
196/* Access fields of GMP struct */
197#define SIZ(x) ((x)->_mp_size)
198#define ABSIZ(x) ABS (SIZ (x))
199#define PTR(x) ((x)->_mp_d)
200#define ALLOC(x) ((x)->_mp_alloc)
201/* For mpf numbers only. */
202#ifdef MPFR_NEED_MPF_INTERNALS
203/* Note: the EXP macro name is reserved when <errno.h> is included.
204 For compatibility with gmp-impl.h (cf --with-gmp-build), we cannot
205 change this macro, but let's define it only when we need it, where
206 <errno.h> will not be included. */
207#define EXP(x) ((x)->_mp_exp)
208#define PREC(x) ((x)->_mp_prec)
209#endif
210
211/* For longlong.h */
212#ifdef HAVE_ATTRIBUTE_MODE
213typedef unsigned int UQItype __attribute__ ((mode (QI)));
214typedef int SItype __attribute__ ((mode (SI)));
215typedef unsigned int USItype __attribute__ ((mode (SI)));
216typedef int DItype __attribute__ ((mode (DI)));
217typedef unsigned int UDItype __attribute__ ((mode (DI)));
218#else
219typedef unsigned char UQItype;
220typedef long SItype;
221typedef unsigned long USItype;
222#ifdef HAVE_LONG_LONG
223typedef long long int DItype;
224typedef unsigned long long int UDItype;
225#else /* Assume `long' gives us a wide enough type. Needed for hppa2.0w. */
226typedef long int DItype;
227typedef unsigned long int UDItype;
228#endif
229#endif
230typedef mp_limb_t UWtype;
231typedef unsigned int UHWtype;
232#define W_TYPE_SIZE GMP_NUMB_BITS
233
234/* Remap names of internal mpn functions (for longlong.h). */
235#undef __clz_tab
236#define __clz_tab mpfr_clz_tab
237
238/* Use (4.0 * ...) instead of (2.0 * ...) to work around buggy compilers
239 that don't convert ulong->double correctly (eg. SunOS 4 native cc). */
240#undef MP_BASE_AS_DOUBLE
241#define MP_BASE_AS_DOUBLE (4.0 * (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 2)))
242
243/* Structure for conversion between internal binary format and
244 strings in base 2..36. */
245struct bases
246{
247 /* log(2)/log(conversion_base) */
248 double chars_per_bit_exactly;
249};
250#undef __mp_bases
251#define __mp_bases mpfr_bases
252__MPFR_DECLSPEC extern const struct bases mpfr_bases[257];
253
254/* Standard macros */
255#undef ABS
256#undef MIN
257#undef MAX
258#define ABS(x) ((x) >= 0 ? (x) : -(x))
259#define MIN(l,o) ((l) < (o) ? (l) : (o))
260#define MAX(h,i) ((h) > (i) ? (h) : (i))
261
262/* Size of an array, safe version but not a constant expression:
263 Since an array can silently be converted to a pointer, we check
264 that this macro is applied on an array, not a pointer. */
265#undef numberof
266#if 0
267/* The following should work with GCC as documented in its manual,
268 but fails: https://gcc.gnu.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=38377#c10
269 Thus disabled for now. */
270# define numberof(x) \
271 ( __extension__ ({ \
272 int is_array = (void *) &(x) == (void *) &(x)[0]; \
273 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (__builtin_constant_p (is_array) ? \
274 is_array : 1); \
275 MPFR_ASSERTN (is_array); \
276 numberof_const (x); \
277 }) )
278#else
279# define numberof(x) \
280 (MPFR_ASSERTN ((void *) &(x) == (void *) &(x)[0]), \
281 numberof_const (x))
282#endif
283
284__MPFR_DECLSPEC void * mpfr_allocate_func (size_t);
285__MPFR_DECLSPEC void * mpfr_reallocate_func (void *, size_t, size_t);
286__MPFR_DECLSPEC void mpfr_free_func (void *, size_t);
287
288#if defined(WANT_GMP_INTERNALS) && defined(HAVE___GMPN_SBPI1_DIVAPPR_Q)
289#ifndef __gmpn_sbpi1_divappr_q
290__MPFR_DECLSPEC mp_limb_t __gmpn_sbpi1_divappr_q (mp_limb_t*,
291 mp_limb_t*, mp_size_t, mp_limb_t*, mp_size_t, mp_limb_t);
292#endif
293#endif
294
295#if defined(WANT_GMP_INTERNALS) && defined(HAVE___GMPN_INVERT_LIMB)
296#ifndef __gmpn_invert_limb
297__MPFR_DECLSPEC mp_limb_t __gmpn_invert_limb (mp_limb_t);
298#endif
299#endif
300
301/* Temp memory allocate */
302struct tmp_marker
303{
304 void *ptr;
305 size_t size;
306 struct tmp_marker *next;
307};
308
309__MPFR_DECLSPEC void *mpfr_tmp_allocate (struct tmp_marker **,
310 size_t);
311__MPFR_DECLSPEC void mpfr_tmp_free (struct tmp_marker *);
312
313/* Can be overriden at configure time. Useful for checking buffer overflow. */
314#ifndef MPFR_ALLOCA_MAX
315# define MPFR_ALLOCA_MAX 16384
316#endif
317
318/* Do not define TMP_SALLOC (see the test in mpfr-impl.h)! */
319#define TMP_ALLOC(n) (MPFR_LIKELY ((n) <= MPFR_ALLOCA_MAX) ? \
320 alloca (n) : mpfr_tmp_allocate (&tmp_marker, (n)))
321#define TMP_DECL(m) struct tmp_marker *tmp_marker
322#define TMP_MARK(m) (tmp_marker = 0)
323/* Note about TMP_FREE: For small precisions, tmp_marker is null as
324 the allocation is done on the stack (see TMP_ALLOC above). */
325#define TMP_FREE(m) \
326 (MPFR_LIKELY (tmp_marker == NULL) ? (void) 0 : mpfr_tmp_free (tmp_marker))
327
328#endif /* gmp-impl.h replacement */
329
330
331
332/******************************************************
333 ****** GMP Interface which changes with versions *****
334 ****** to other versions of GMP. Add missing *****
335 ****** interfaces. *****
336 ******************************************************/
337
338/* If mpn_sqr is not defined, use mpn_mul_n instead
339 (mpn_sqr was called mpn_sqr_n (internal) in older versions of GMP). */
340#ifndef mpn_sqr
341# define mpn_sqr(dst,src,n) mpn_mul_n((dst),(src),(src),(n))
342#endif
343
344/* invert_limb macro, copied from GMP 5.0.2, file gmp-impl.h.
345 It returns invxl = floor((B^2-1)/xl)-B, where B=2^BITS_PER_LIMB,
346 assuming the most significant bit of xl is set. */
347#ifndef invert_limb
348#if defined(WANT_GMP_INTERNALS) && defined(HAVE___GMPN_INVERT_LIMB)
349#define invert_limb(invxl,xl) \
350 do { \
351 invxl = __gmpn_invert_limb (xl); \
352 } while (0)
353#else
354#define invert_limb(invxl,xl) \
355 do { \
356 mp_limb_t dummy MPFR_MAYBE_UNUSED; \
357 MPFR_ASSERTD ((xl) != 0); \
358 udiv_qrnnd (invxl, dummy, ~(xl), MPFR_LIMB_MAX, xl); \
359 } while (0)
360#endif /* defined(WANT_GMP_INTERNALS) && defined(HAVE___GMPN_INVERT_LIMB) */
361#endif /* ifndef invert_limb */
362
363/* udiv_qr_3by2 macro, adapted from GMP 5.0.2, file gmp-impl.h.
364 Compute quotient the quotient and remainder for n / d. Requires d
365 >= B^2 / 2 and n < d B. dinv is the inverse
366
367 floor ((B^3 - 1) / (d0 + d1 B)) - B.
368
369 NOTE: Output variables are updated multiple times. Only some inputs
370 and outputs may overlap.
371*/
372#ifndef udiv_qr_3by2
373#define udiv_qr_3by2(q, r1, r0, n2, n1, n0, d1, d0, dinv) \
374 do { \
375 mp_limb_t _q0, _t1, _t0, _mask; \
376 umul_ppmm ((q), _q0, (n2), (dinv)); \
377 add_ssaaaa ((q), _q0, (q), _q0, (n2), (n1)); \
378 \
379 /* Compute the two most significant limbs of n - q'd */ \
380 (r1) = (n1) - (d1) * (q); \
381 (r0) = (n0); \
382 sub_ddmmss ((r1), (r0), (r1), (r0), (d1), (d0)); \
383 umul_ppmm (_t1, _t0, (d0), (q)); \
384 sub_ddmmss ((r1), (r0), (r1), (r0), _t1, _t0); \
385 (q)++; \
386 \
387 /* Conditionally adjust q and the remainders */ \
388 _mask = - (mp_limb_t) ((r1) >= _q0); \
389 (q) += _mask; \
390 add_ssaaaa ((r1), (r0), (r1), (r0), _mask & (d1), _mask & (d0)); \
391 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY ((r1) >= (d1))) \
392 { \
393 if ((r1) > (d1) || (r0) >= (d0)) \
394 { \
395 (q)++; \
396 sub_ddmmss ((r1), (r0), (r1), (r0), (d1), (d0)); \
397 } \
398 } \
399 } while (0)
400#endif
401
402/* invert_pi1 macro adapted from GMP 5 */
403typedef struct {mp_limb_t inv32;} mpfr_pi1_t;
404#ifndef invert_pi1
405#define invert_pi1(dinv, d1, d0) \
406 do { \
407 mp_limb_t _v, _p, _t1, _t0, _mask; \
408 invert_limb (_v, d1); \
409 _p = (d1) * _v; \
410 _p += (d0); \
411 if (_p < (d0)) \
412 { \
413 _v--; \
414 _mask = -(mp_limb_t) (_p >= (d1)); \
415 _p -= (d1); \
416 _v += _mask; \
417 _p -= _mask & (d1); \
418 } \
419 umul_ppmm (_t1, _t0, d0, _v); \
420 _p += _t1; \
421 if (_p < _t1) \
422 { \
423 _v--; \
424 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (_p >= (d1))) \
425 { \
426 if (_p > (d1) || _t0 >= (d0)) \
427 _v--; \
428 } \
429 } \
430 (dinv).inv32 = _v; \
431 } while (0)
432#endif
433
434/* The following macro is copied from GMP-6.1.1, file gmp-impl.h,
435 macro udiv_qrnnd_preinv.
436 It computes q and r such that nh*2^GMP_NUMB_BITS + nl = q*d + r,
437 with 0 <= r < d, assuming di = __gmpn_invert_limb (d). */
438#define __udiv_qrnnd_preinv(q, r, nh, nl, d, di) \
439 do { \
440 mp_limb_t _qh, _ql, _r, _mask; \
441 umul_ppmm (_qh, _ql, (nh), (di)); \
442 if (__builtin_constant_p (nl) && (nl) == 0) \
443 { \
444 _qh += (nh) + 1; \
445 _r = - _qh * (d); \
446 _mask = -(mp_limb_t) (_r > _ql); /* both > and >= are OK */ \
447 _qh += _mask; \
448 _r += _mask & (d); \
449 } \
450 else \
451 { \
452 add_ssaaaa (_qh, _ql, _qh, _ql, (nh) + 1, (nl)); \
453 _r = (nl) - _qh * (d); \
454 _mask = -(mp_limb_t) (_r > _ql); /* both > and >= are OK */ \
455 _qh += _mask; \
456 _r += _mask & (d); \
457 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (_r >= (d))) \
458 { \
459 _r -= (d); \
460 _qh++; \
461 } \
462 } \
463 (r) = _r; \
464 (q) = _qh; \
465 } while (0)
466
467#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
468/* specialized version for nl = 0, with di computed inside */
469#define __udiv_qrnd_preinv(q, r, nh, d) \
470 do { \
471 mp_limb_t _di; \
472 \
473 MPFR_ASSERTD ((d) != 0); \
474 MPFR_ASSERTD ((nh) < (d)); \
475 MPFR_ASSERTD ((d) & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT); \
476 \
477 __gmpfr_invert_limb (_di, d); \
478 __udiv_qrnnd_preinv (q, r, nh, 0, d, _di); \
479 } while (0)
480#elif defined(WANT_GMP_INTERNALS) && defined(HAVE___GMPN_INVERT_LIMB)
481/* specialized version for nl = 0, with di computed inside */
482#define __udiv_qrnd_preinv(q, r, nh, d) \
483 do { \
484 mp_limb_t _di; \
485 \
486 MPFR_ASSERTD ((d) != 0); \
487 MPFR_ASSERTD ((nh) < (d)); \
488 MPFR_ASSERTD ((d) & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT); \
489 \
490 _di = __gmpn_invert_limb (d); \
491 __udiv_qrnnd_preinv (q, r, nh, 0, d, _di); \
492 } while (0)
493#else
494/* Same as __udiv_qrnnd_c from longlong.h, but using a single UWType/UWtype
495 division instead of two, and with n0=0. The analysis below assumes a limb
496 has 64 bits for simplicity. */
497#define __udiv_qrnd_preinv(q, r, n1, d) \
498 do { \
499 UWtype __d1, __d0, __q1, __q0, __r1, __r0, __i; \
500 \
501 MPFR_ASSERTD ((d) != 0); \
502 MPFR_ASSERTD ((n1) < (d)); \
503 MPFR_ASSERTD ((d) & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT); \
504 \
505 __d1 = __ll_highpart (d); \
506 /* 2^31 <= d1 < 2^32 */ \
507 __d0 = __ll_lowpart (d); \
508 /* 0 <= d0 < 2^32 */ \
509 __i = ~(UWtype) 0 / __d1; \
510 /* 2^32 < i < 2^33 with i < 2^64/d1 */ \
511 \
512 __q1 = (((n1) / __ll_B) * __i) / __ll_B; \
513 /* Since n1 < d, high(n1) <= d1 = high(d), thus */ \
514 /* q1 <= high(n1) * (2^64/d1) / 2^32 <= 2^32 */ \
515 /* and also q1 <= n1/d1 thus r1 >= 0 below */ \
516 __r1 = (n1) - __q1 * __d1; \
517 while (__r1 >= __d1) \
518 __q1 ++, __r1 -= __d1; \
519 /* by construction, we have n1 = q1*d1+r1, and 0 <= r1 < d1 */ \
520 /* thus q1 <= n1/d1 < 2^32+2 */ \
521 /* q1*d0 <= (2^32+1)*(2^32-1) <= 2^64-1 thus it fits in a limb. */ \
522 __r0 = __r1 * __ll_B; \
523 __r1 = __r0 - __q1 * __d0; \
524 /* At most two corrections are needed like in __udiv_qrnnd_c. */ \
525 if (__r1 > __r0) /* borrow when subtracting q1*d0 */ \
526 { \
527 __q1--, __r1 += (d); \
528 if (__r1 > (d)) /* no carry when adding d */ \
529 __q1--, __r1 += (d); \
530 } \
531 /* We can have r1 < m here, but in this case the true remainder */ \
532 /* is 2^64+r1, which is > m (same analysis as below for r0). */ \
533 /* Now we have n1*2^32 = q1*d + r1, with 0 <= r1 < d. */ \
534 MPFR_ASSERTD(__r1 < (d)); \
535 \
536 /* The same analysis as above applies, with n1 replaced by r1, */ \
537 /* q1 by q0, r1 by r0. */ \
538 __q0 = ((__r1 / __ll_B) * __i) / __ll_B; \
539 __r0 = __r1 - __q0 * __d1; \
540 while (__r0 >= __d1) \
541 __q0 ++, __r0 -= __d1; \
542 __r1 = __r0 * __ll_B; \
543 __r0 = __r1 - __q0 * __d0; \
544 /* We know the quotient floor(r1*2^64/d) is q0, q0-1 or q0-2.*/ \
545 if (__r0 > __r1) /* borrow when subtracting q0*d0 */ \
546 { \
547 /* The quotient is either q0-1 or q0-2. */ \
548 __q0--, __r0 += (d); \
549 if (__r0 > (d)) /* no carry when adding d */ \
550 __q0--, __r0 += (d); \
551 } \
552 /* Now we have n1*2^64 = (q1*2^32+q0)*d + r0, with 0 <= r0 < d. */ \
553 MPFR_ASSERTD(__r0 < (d)); \
554 \
555 (q) = __q1 * __ll_B | __q0; \
556 (r) = __r0; \
557 } while (0)
558#endif
559
560/******************************************************
561 ************* GMP Basic Pointer Types ****************
562 ******************************************************/
563
564typedef mp_limb_t *mpfr_limb_ptr;
565typedef const mp_limb_t *mpfr_limb_srcptr;
566
567/* mpfr_ieee_double_extract structure (copied from GMP 6.1.0, gmp-impl.h, with
568 ieee_double_extract changed into mpfr_ieee_double_extract, and
569 _GMP_IEEE_FLOATS changed into _MPFR_IEEE_FLOATS). */
570
571/* Define mpfr_ieee_double_extract and _MPFR_IEEE_FLOATS.
572
573 Bit field packing is "implementation defined" according to C99, which
574 leaves us at the compiler's mercy here. For some systems packing is
575 defined in the ABI (eg. x86). In any case so far it seems universal that
576 little endian systems pack from low to high, and big endian from high to
577 low within the given type.
578
579 Within the fields we rely on the integer endianness being the same as the
580 float endianness, this is true everywhere we know of and it'd be a fairly
581 strange system that did anything else. */
582
583/* Note for MPFR: building with "gcc -std=c89 -pedantic -pedantic-errors"
584 fails if the bit-field type is unsigned long:
585
586 error: type of bit-field '...' is a GCC extension [-Wpedantic]
587
588 Though with -std=c99 no errors are obtained, this is still an extension
589 in C99, which says:
590
591 A bit-field shall have a type that is a qualified or unqualified version
592 of _Bool, signed int, unsigned int, or some other implementation-defined
593 type.
594
595 So, unsigned int should be better. This will fail with implementations
596 having 16-bit int's, but such implementations are not required to
597 support bit-fields of size > 16 anyway; if ever an implementation with
598 16-bit int's is found, the appropriate minimal changes could still be
599 done in the future.
600*/
601
602#ifndef _MPFR_IEEE_FLOATS
603
604#ifdef HAVE_DOUBLE_IEEE_LITTLE_ENDIAN
605#define _MPFR_IEEE_FLOATS 1
606union mpfr_ieee_double_extract
607{
608 struct
609 {
610 unsigned int manl:32;
611 unsigned int manh:20;
612 unsigned int exp:11;
613 unsigned int sig:1;
614 } s;
615 double d;
616};
617#endif
618
619#ifdef HAVE_DOUBLE_IEEE_BIG_ENDIAN
620#define _MPFR_IEEE_FLOATS 1
621union mpfr_ieee_double_extract
622{
623 struct
624 {
625 unsigned int sig:1;
626 unsigned int exp:11;
627 unsigned int manh:20;
628 unsigned int manl:32;
629 } s;
630 double d;
631};
632#endif
633
634#endif /* _MPFR_IEEE_FLOATS */
635
636/******************************************************
637 ******************** C++ Compatibility ***************
638 ******************************************************/
639#if defined (__cplusplus)
640}
641#endif
642
643#endif /* Gmp internal emulator */
644
